title.narrative: WH5- Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SECTOR GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: By 2021, state structures are in a position to effectively coordinate, monitor, assess and manage the sector's knowledge in emergency response and development areas., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: People living in disadvantaged areas, especially women and children and people affected by emergencies, use safe, affordable sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems
Water supply in emergencies - improving water supply services communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, state structures are in a position to effectively coordinate, monitor, assess and manage the sector's knowledge in emergency response and development areas.

description.narrative: UNICEF has supported government partners to ensure effective coordination of the program, monitoring and control of activities implemented by partners both emergencies and development. UNICEF also participated to capacity building for implementing and government partners. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:26/12/2019

actual.value: 2019:A little progress to relance the mecanism.

baseline.value: Sector policy documents exists but not include conflict impact and climate change/disaster reduction
